message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the composition of the Earth's crust. The Earth's crust is the outermost layer of the Earth, and it is made up of solid rocks and minerals. Option (D) is correct because worms are living organisms that can be found in the soil, which is part of the Earth's crust. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because clouds, stars, and air are not found on the crust of the Earth, but rather in the atmosphere above the crust.

Clouds are in the atmosphere, stars are celestial objects in space, and air is also part of the atmosphere.
